business.headline: PM's Diwali gift delivered: Nirmala Sitharaman presents GST 2.0 report cardGST Bachat Utsav: Sitharaman, addressing a press conference along with ministers Piyush Goyal and Ashwini Vaishnaw ahead of Diwali, said the GST rate cuts resulted in bumper sales of cars and electronics.

Gold prices near record high on Dhanteras: Should you buy?Gold prices have been on a relentless rally, hitting new record highs almost every day. But does this glittering streak make it the right fit for your investment portfolio this Dhanteras?

Gold flashing a big warning signal: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu says amid rising pricesAs gold prices soar globally, Zoho's Sridhar Vembu raises a red flag. Does the surge signal investor anxiety and eroding trust in the system or reveal a deeper economic fault line?

Gold prices hit record high ahead of Dhanteras, see Rs 3,200 hike in DelhiTraders said gold buying activity picked up sharply as stockists built fresh positions on expectations of higher sales during the festive season.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.
Sensex ends 484 points higher, Nifty above 25,700; Asian Paints jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 484.53 points higher at 83,952.19, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 124.55 points to close at 25,709.85.

Diwali 2025: From ETFs to SGBs, 5 smart ways to invest in goldWith gold prices at record levels this Diwali, many people are rethinking whether to buy jewellery or look at smarter investment routes. From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Buying just gold on Dhanteras? Why you should consider a mutual fund SIPAs Dhanteras's theme shifts from gold to goal-based investing, here is a detailed guide to help investors make smarter, purpose-driven financial choices this festive season.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

IMF chief says open trade key for India's continued economic riseIMF Director Kristalina Georgieva said that India stands out as one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and continues to make a major contribution to global growth because of its consistent reform efforts.

entertainment.headline: KBC 17: Sunil Grover dances with Big B, Krushna jokingly asks about his salary In the upcoming episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', actor Sunil Grover will be seen grooving to Amitabh Bachchan's iconic songs. Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek will also join them as Dharmendra.

Sunny Deol turns 68: Bobby, Karan, Esha and Ameesha send warm birthday wishes Actor Sunny Deol celebrated his 68th birthday with warm wishes from family and co-stars. He also unveiled the first look of his upcoming film Gabru, set to release in March 2026.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan says he is still bearing burden of things he never did Actor Salman Khan advised Amaal Mallik to manage his temper after a heated conflict with Farhana Bhatt. The caution highlights the importance of mental strength in handling public criticism and personal behaviour.

Squid Game's Lee Byung-hun poses with SRK, Aamir; fans can't stay calm Shah Rukh Khan posed with 'Squid Game' star Lee Byung Hun and other global celebrities. Fans reacted to Shah Rukh and Aamir Khan's meeting with the South Korean actor.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha welcome baby boy: Arms full, hearts fuller Following their recent relocation to Delhi, Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha announced the arrival of their baby boy on Chhoti Diwali via a heartfelt Instagram post.

Samay Raina gifts himself Toyota Vellfire on Dhanteras; joins Aamir, Kriti's league Stand-up comedian Samay Raina celebrated Diwali by buying a luxurious Toyota Vellfire. His purchase signals a strong career comeback after recent public controversies.

Sunny Deol marks 68th birthday with new film Gabru, unveils first look Actor Sunny Deol announces 'Gabru' on his 68th birthday and shares the film's first look on social media. The 'Gadar 2' actor had a midnight celebration with family and fans, highlighted by festive lights and fireworks.

Anupamaa cast upset with Smriti Irani for reportedly demeaning Rupali Ganguly Smriti Irani's comments on not viewing 'Anupamaa' as competition have led to strong responses from the show's cast. Cast members highlighted the need for healthy competition and respect for each other's achievements in the television industry.
Parineeti Chopra admitted to hospital for delivery of her first child: Sources Actor Parineeti Chopra was admitted to the hospital for the delivery of her first child with husband Raghav Chadha.

Kareena, Karisma and Saif at Soha Ali Khan's pre-Diwali celebrations. See pics Soha Ali Khan offered a look into her pre-Diwali festivities with family members, including Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan. The actor demonstrated a unique approach to Diwali cleaning through her workout routine in the gym.

Palash Muchhal confirms wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana Filmmaker and musician Palash Muchhal confirms Smriti Mandhana as his bride-to-be, set to become Indore's daughter-in-law. The couple's relationship has been the subject of speculation for a while, and this announcement marks the first official confirmation.

AP Dhillon shares why he stays away from Bollywood's music industry Singer AP Dhillon has criticised current industry practices, claiming Bollywood exploits Punjabi artists for profit. He stresses the importance of solidarity among senior Punjabi artists to prevent exploitation of younger talent.

30 years after DDLJ: How patriarchal fathers still rule Bollywood Even 30 years after 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', Bollywood continues to show fathers who control their daughters' marriage choices, reflecting persistent patriarchal norms. Later films like 'Kabir Singh' and '2 States' highlight how toxic fatherhood still influences women's autonomy in love and marriage on screen.

Puneet Issar's moving tribute to Pankaj Dheer: Our bond was stronger than brothers Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, famed for portraying Karna in 'Mahabharat', died in Mumbai on October 15, 2025 at 68 after battling cancer.  Puneet Issar, his close friend and co-star, shared heartfelt memories and quoted lines from the Mahabharata in tribute.

Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers dies at 48, band pays tribute to his legacy Metal band Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers has died at the age of 48, as announced by the band on social media. Rivers had significant health challenges, including liver disease and a transplant in 2017.

Empty seats, long wait at India debut: Fan posts say Travis Scott won't come back Rapper Travis Scott's India debut in Delhi received mixed reviews, with reports of empty seats and delays. Over 3,400 personnel were assigned for security, aiming for a smooth experience for attendees.

Anupam Kher says he manages brother Raju's finances, praises wife Kirron Actor Anupam Kher has spoken publicly about taking care of his brother Raju Kher's finances.  He has praised his wife, Kirron Kher, for never questioning his supportive decisions.

Inside Mr Scorsese: The documentary revealing the filmmaker we never truly knew The new documentary series 'Mr. Scorsese' unveils the filmmaker behind the myth — a man torn between faith and fury, guilt and genius, who turned his search for moral truth into one of the most profound cinematic journeys ever made.

BB19 Episode 55: Amaal Mallik cries as Salman, father Dabboo Mallik scold him Actor Salman Khan reprimanded Amaal Mallik on 'Bigg Boss 19' for using derogatory language against Farhana Bhatt. The episode saw emotional moments as Dabboo Mallik scolded his son, highlighting tensions in the house.

general news.headline: GRAP-2 anti-pollution curbs in Delhi-NCR as air quality worsens before DiwaliAuthorities have implemented GRAP-2 restrictions across Delhi-NCR, including curbs on construction and industrial emissions, to combat rising pollution. Out of 38 monitoring stations, 12 reported "very poor" air quality on Sunday evening.

River of diyas, chorus of aarti, 2 world records: Ayodhya's Diwali makes historyAyodhya created two records, the lighting of 26,17,215 diyas along with the record for the most people simultaneously performing diya rotation.

They fired on devotees, we light lamps: Yogi Adityanath jabs Opposition in AyodhyaTaking a dig at the Samajwadi Party and the INDIA bloc at large, Adityanath said those who had "fired bullets" at karsevaks during the Ram Mandir movement never attended the temple's grand opening in 2024.

IND vs ENG live: Mandhana departs, England still in huntWomen's World Cup, India (IND) vs England (ENG) live score: India are in control of the 289 chase despite the big wicket of Smriti Mandhana, and England will need some quick wickets to shake the momentum from here on.

How Diwali lights tell a dark India-China storyIndian Diwali string lights and a Chinese connector reveal the disconnect in India's manufacturing ecosystem. Even good quality Indian products rely on jugaad, exposing the risk to Make in India and Buy Swadeshi campaigns. Will Indians ever be able to switch on Diwali lights and make India, not China, shine bright?

Basket lift, disc cutter: How Louvre robbers carried out brazen 4-minute heistThieves executed a rapid four-minute robbery at the Louvre Museum in Paris, stealing Napoleon-era jewels using a basket lift and disc cutter. The incident highlights renewed concerns over museum security and public safety.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha welcome baby boy: Arms full, hearts fullerFollowing their recent relocation to Delhi, Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha announced the arrival of their baby boy on Chhoti Diwali via a heartfelt Instagram post.

Akhilesh Yadav suggests not to spend on diyas in Diwali, BJP calls him 'Anthony'Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav faced backlash from the VHP after suggesting that the UP government should avoid "wasting money" on Diwali diyas, drawing parallels with Christmas celebrations.

How a coconut crisis is changing the taste of IndiaCoconut prices have exploded across India, leaving households and hawkers equally stunned. The coconut crisis is reflected in crispy banana chips to everyday curries and chutneys. What's causing this steep surge, and how long will the naryial crunch last?

How Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma failed against Australia, once againIndia vs Australia: Australia fast bowlers once again had the number of the Indian top-order. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill failed in India's return to the ODI format.

Pregnant woman stabbed by lover in Delhi; husband snatches knife, kills attackerAccording to police, the pregnant woman, Shalini, was attacked multiple times with a knife by her former live-in partner, Aashu, in Delhi's Nabi Karim area late on Saturday night. In a desperate bid to save his wife, the husband intervened and fatally injured the attacker, who was declared dead on arrival at the hospital.

Gone in 4 minutes: Paris's Louvre shut as robbers make off with Napoleon's jewelsChainsaw-wielding robbers stormed Paris's Louvre Museum and escaped with nine priceless Napoleon-era jewels in a daring daylight heist that lasted for four minutes. The museum was shut for the day as a police investigation is on.

30 years after DDLJ: How patriarchal fathers still rule BollywoodEven 30 years after 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', Bollywood continues to show fathers who control their daughters' marriage choices, reflecting persistent patriarchal norms. Later films like 'Kabir Singh' and '2 States' highlight how toxic fatherhood still influences women's autonomy in love and marriage on screen.

25,000 Americans would die, says Trump as US bombs 'drug-carrying submarine'A video posted by the Pentagon on X showed black-and-white footage of the strike. In the clip, the semi-submersible vessel could be seen gliding through the waves with its front portion submerged just below the surface before a series of explosions struck, one detonating over the vessel's rear.

Australia spoil Gill's ODI captaincy debut as Rohit, Kohli flop on comebackAustralia vs India, 1st ODI: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli looked rusty on their return to international cricket, while the rest of India's batting line-up appeared undercooked as the pace and bounce in Perth proved too hot to handle. Australia cruised to a seven-wicket win, chasing 131 with ease in a rain-affected match on Sunday to take a 1–0 lead in the three-match series.

Israel strikes Gaza's Rafah amid fragile truce, accuses Hamas of violating dealThe Israeli military said air force jets struck an area in Rafah after "terrorists" opened fire on troops. It also said that Hamas's actions "blatantly violated" the US-brokered ceasefire agreement.

Mad rush on trains, beelines at stations: Diwali, Chhath crowd overwhelms railwaysThe Indian Railways has introduced dozens of festival-special trains, tightened security, and deployed additional staff at key junctions including Surat, Mumbai, Lucknow, and Jhansi. However, scenes of overcrowded platforms, long queues and unsafe travel conditions continue to expose the pressure on India's transport infrastructure during peak festive weeks.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Teen's brawl with cops over liquor seizure at birthday party, father arrestedTwo people, including a 19-year-old man, were arrested after the teenager clashed with police personnel after police seized liquor during a party held to celebrate his businessman father's birthday at a hotel in Gujarat's Surat.

Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's comeback in Adelaide ODI won't surprise me: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can recover after their Perth ODI flop. Despite challenging conditions, the experience of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma could make the Adelaide ODI a thrilling comeback.

Steve Jobs named a computer after his daughter, but denied she existedIn 1978, Steve Jobs denied that he was the father of his newborn daughter, Lisa, even as Apple secretly developed a $50 million computer with the same name. Decades later, Lisa Brennan-Jobs's memoir Small Fry revealed how her father's denial, cruelty, and late confession became Silicon Valley's most human story.

Break legs of disobedient daughters who visit non-Hindus: Pragya Thakur's shockerFormer Bhopal MP Pragya Thakur urged parents to physically punish their daughters, claiming it was for their own better future. She also called upon parents to be "more vigilant" towards "girls who do not follow values" and "are ready to run away from home."

Samosa vendor drags customer by collar after UPI payment fails.A passenger at Jabalpur railway station was forced to hand over his wristwatch after a failed digital payment. DRM Jabalpur has reacted to the video and started an investigation.

Trump labels Colombian president drug leader, vows to end US aid to the countryRelations between Bogota and Washington have frayed since Trump returned to office. Last month the United States revoked Colombian President Gustavo Petro's visa after he joined a pro-Palestinian demonstration in New York and urged US soldiers to disobey Trump's orders.

KBC 17: Sunil Grover dances with Big B, Krushna jokingly asks about his salaryIn the upcoming episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', actor Sunil Grover will be seen grooving to Amitabh Bachchan's iconic songs. Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek will also join them as Dharmendra.

Sunny Deol turns 68: Bobby, Karan, Esha and Ameesha send warm birthday wishesActor Sunny Deol celebrated his 68th birthday with warm wishes from family and co-stars. He also unveiled the first look of his upcoming film Gabru, set to release in March 2026.

sports.headline: Perth ODI win was solid, but India still capable of a comeback: Matthew Kuhnemann Australia's Matthew Kuhnemann lauded his team's dominant Perth ODI win but warned against complacency, acknowledging India's proven ability to fight back. The left-arm spinner said Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's experience makes India dangerous ahead of the Adelaide clash.

Virat Kohli, don't argue with yourself after Perth ODI flopshow: Matthew Hayden AUS vs IND: Matthew Hayden urged Virat Kohli to trust his technique after the Perth ODI setback. He stressed that one poor innings shouldn't undermine Kohli's confidence as India head into the Adelaide ODI against Australia.

Shubman Gill is like Rohit Sharma, both are bowler's captains: Arshdeep Singh Arshdeep Singh reflected on how both Shubman Gill and Rohit Sharma are as captains, suggesting that both are leaders who give total freedom to their bowlers to execute their plans.

Virat Kohli will score runs vs Australia, form is just a word to him: Arshdeep Singh Arshdeep Singh expresses strong belief in Virat Kohli's ability to perform in the ongoing ODI series against Australia. Despite Kohli's early dismissal, the team expects him to rebound and lead India's batting charge.

Won't be too harsh on Kohli and Rohit for Perth ODI flop: Sunil Gavaskar AUS vs IND: Indian cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar refused to be too critical of the legendary duo Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's forgetful ODI return in the Perth ODI vs Australia. He highlighted how the Perth pitch troubled every Indian batter, and the duo weren't the only victims.

AUS vs IND: Harshit Rana faces the wrath of social media after poor show in Perth Harshit Rana faced heavy criticism for his bowling in the ODI opener against Australia in Perth. His loose deliveries and lack of wickets raised doubts about his place in the Indian team.

Pakistan lashes out at ICC for biased statement in solidarity with Afghanistan The ICC and BCCI on Saturday condoled the deaths of Afghan cricketers in an aerial attack in Paktika Province, without mentioning Pakistan. Pakistan's Information Minister dismissed the statements, saying Afghanistan had claimed the deaths of three local cricketers without providing evidence.

Rohit, Gill share popcorn bucket during rain break, commentator has a laughAustralia vs India, 1st ODI: During one of the multiple rain breaks on Sunday, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen having a lengthy chat in the dressing room, sharing a bucket of popcorn. Both Rohit and Shubman Gill were dismissed cheaply in the series opener in Perth.

IND vs ENG live: Mandhana departs, England still in huntWomen's World Cup, India (IND) vs England (ENG) live score: Nat Sciver-Brunt has got the all-important wicket of Harmanpreet Kaur as England make a brief comeback. Deepti Sharma has joined Smriti Mandhana in the middle.

No vadapav, 800 reps daily: Rohit trained like a bodybuilder for ODI comebackAfter months away from international cricket, Rohit Sharma returned leaner, lighter and hungrier. Under the watchful eye of Abhishek Nayar, the former India captain endured a punishing three-hour daily routine, swapping his beloved vadapav for 800-rep workouts in a bid to extend his career to the 2027 World Cup.

Rohit, Kohli told to take MS Dhoni route after flopping on ODI returnRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have been advised to draw inspiration from MS Dhoni and play domestic cricket for better match practice after failing on their ODI return against Australia.

Did Mitchell Starc just bowl the fastest ball in ODI history to Rohit Sharma?India vs Australia: Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc bowled a brilliant morning spell against the India batters. One of his deliveries was clocked at 176.5 kmph.

Rashid Khan removes PSL team Lahore Qalandars from X profile after Pak airstrikesAfghanistan T20I skipper Rashid Khan has taken Lahore Qalandars out of his Twitter bio, objecting to Pakistani airstrikes that killed Afghan civilians, including three young cricketers. Afghanistan have also pulled out from the tri-series involving Pakistan.

Sunday ruined: Virat Kohli out for 0, Rohit Sharma flops on ODI comebacks in PerthIndia tour of Australia: The much-anticipated ODI comebacks of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma didn't go as planned. Former captain Rohit managed just 8 runs, while Kohli fell for a duck after Australia opted to bowl in the series opener in Perth on Sunday, October 19.

Why Virat Kohli opted to spend time in London after Test retirementLegendary Virat Kohli opened up on his six-month-long break in London where he stayed away from the eyes of the media. Kohli said that he was enjoying this new phase of life.

Afghanistan have also pulled out from the tri-series involving Pakistan.

Former captain Rohit managed just 8 runs, while Kohli fell for a duck after Australia opted to bowl in the series opener in Perth on Sunday, October 19.

Why Virat Kohli opted to spend time in London after Test retirementLegendary Virat Kohli opened up on his six-month-long break in London where he stayed away from the eyes of the media. Kohli said that he was enjoying this new phase of life.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli return in Perth, Nitish Reddy makes ODI debutIndian stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli made their return to international cricket at Perth. The Indian team also handed an ODI debut to Nitish Kumar Reddy.

Struggling India look for redemption against spin-heavy EnglandWomen's World Cup, IND vs ENG: India aim to bounce back from consecutive defeats, while England look to secure a semi-final berth when they face each other on Sunday in Indore.

Six Kings slam: Jannik Sinner thrashes Carlos Alcaraz to win 2nd successive titleJannik Sinner defeated Carlos Alcaraz 6-2, 6-4 in the Six Kings Slam final, reversing his US Open defeat and earning a record-setting $6 million. Sinner's enhanced serve made the difference, while both players showed mutual respect throughout a match streamed globally.

1st ODI Highlights: RoKo comeback spoilt after India lose Perth ODIIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Highlights, 1st ODI: Australia have successfully spoilt the RoKo comeback after beating India by 7 wickets to bag the Perth ODI. Mitchell Marsh attacking batting and the lack of girth in India's bowling attack is the summary of the match.

La Liga: Araujo nets late winner as Barcelona beat Girona, Flick to miss El ClasicoRonald Araújo scored a dramatic stoppage-time winner to hand Barcelona a 2-1 victory over Girona in La Liga, helping the team move to the top of the table and end a two-match losing streak before their upcoming encounter with Real Madrid.

Satwik-Chirag's magical run in Denmark Open ends with semi-final exitSatwik-Chirag's magical run in the Denmark Open came to an end on Saturday, October 18 as lost to Japan's Takuro Hoki and Yugo Kobayashi in a three-game thriller. The Indian duo bounced back after losing the first game but ultimately went down fighting.

Rishad Hossain's historic spell sinks West Indies as Bangladesh take 1-0 leadBAN vs WI: Bangladesh took a 1-0 lead in the series against the West Indies after winning the opening game by 74 runs at the Sher-e-Bangla National Stadium in Mirpur. Rishad Hossain scored 26 runs and picked up a six-wicket haul.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
